ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawling progress problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, https://intel.taleo.net/servlets/art.product.careersection.identityprovider.login.LoginController is really taking a long time to error out with 503.

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawling progress problem

X-Yahoo-Profile: iranitovic

Hello,

https://intel.taleo.net/servlets/art.product.careersection.identityprovider.login.LoginController
is really taking a long time to 'error out' with 503. Looking at the the 
crawl.log you can see that it took 4 attempts to get 503.
It is possible that we timed out first three times. Take a look at the 
local errors log. You will probably see -2 codes for this URL.
These timeouts in combination with of dynamic politeness and retry delay 
(default 15 minutes) probably accounts for the idle time of 45 minutes.

The second idle period is related to 
https://intel.taleo.net/servlets/art.product.careersection.identityprovider.register.RegisterController
It timed out 30 times and finally the crawler gave up and moving to the 
next URI. Now, 30 retries of 15 minutes is about 7.5 hours. The second 
delay was only about 5.5 hours. So, it seems that you did change retry 
delay and that it worked. Again take a look at the local errors log. 
Search for the URL and see timestamps of each retry.

I hope that I got the math right.

Take care,
i.


blah_1977 wrote:
> Hi all,
>       Heritrix seems to get stuck on a site that I'm crawling.  I let
> the crawl run overnight, and it eventually finished crawling 101 pages
> in just under 8 hours.  Below is a portion of the crawl
> log that has me scratching my head.  You'll notice that there's an
> approx. 40 min. delay between the entries at 4:19 and 5:03.  Then
> there's a several hour delay between the entries 5:04 and 10:26, and
> also between 10:26 and 12:13.  I'm using Heritrix 1.10.1 out of the
> box with the default profile to crawl this site.  I've tried adjusting
> "retry-delay-seconds" in BdbFrontier, as well as "timeout-seconds" in
> FetchHTTP without any luck.  Anybody have any ideas on how to prevent
> these long delays in the crawl?  Thanks much!
>
